result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua David Luce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count #1 court withholds sentence 5 years probation consecutive to 14CM415 -  conditions of probation costs $528.00  restitution to victim T Kintzinger $185.00 D Banas $1687.65,  plus surcharges. J&S with co-defendants, no contact wit victims or co-defendants, ( S Robertson, T J Quagon, N Blank, J Blank, D Banis, B Abendroth, T Kintzinger),  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.  obtain HSED , obtain employment, DEF can no longer vote.

miscConds.notes: $185.00 and $1687.65 plus sucharges   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. records.addlTxt: When this comes back from DOC please review the assessments because the DE was accidentally assessed restitution for the same three victims and amounts in both cases 15CF90 & 15CF91. The Amended Restitution Order will confirm which victims should be assessed into each case. The amended restitution order was uploaded to the DOC Interface and a seperate email was sent to DOC regarding this.

from WI Dept. of Corrections
given to SH for payment
sentencing hearing, January 12, 2018

Defendant Joshua David Luce in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received revocation packet and have no additions or corrections.
State argues for sentence: 10 yrs prison, 5 yrs in and 5 yrs extended supervision with rehabilitation services.  Atty McLaughlin argues for sentence to follow probation dept's recommendation: 4 yrs; 2 yrs in custody and 2 yrs extended supervision. 
DEF addresses court. Court addresses DEF.

Court: Orders 8 yrs: 4 yrs confinement and 4 yrs extended supervision. Credit given for 154 days. DEF is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.   Convert from DOC Collect to Clerk of Courts Collect - any costs, fines or restitution still oweing.  DOC authorized to deduct from prison account for costs, fines or restitution, by a percentage of their discretion.
Remanded to Dodge Correctional unless Sheriff chooses to keep in Sawyer County due to pending case.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 12, 2018 at 12:00 pm.
Off the Record -Attorney James McLaughlin in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for January 12, 2018 at 12:00 pm.

Clerk contacted the Public Defender's office by phone.  It was verified that Jim McLaughlin was appointed in September, but court did not receive paperwork.  Public Defender's office emailed notice of hearing to Atty Jim McLaughlin about the telephone conference scheduled for Monday the 13th of November, since clerk could not send electronic notice to Atty McLaughlin.

Defendant Joshua David Luce in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court has discussion with DE, who has been unable to get in contact with his attorney James McLaughlin.  Atty  Poquette states he spoke to Atty McLaughlin, just prior to this hearing, and he stated he could not appear in court.  Matter reset for scheduling.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for November 13, 2017 at 08:25 am.
